this is Celia Duggar reporting from Cape
Town the University of Cape Town on the
scenic slopes of Devil's Peak is
considered the best in South Africa it
was mostly off-limits for non-white
applicants during apartheid now it's
making an aggressive attempt to become
more diverse through affirmative action
but a debate has erupted over whether
considering race and admissions is the
best way to address persistent
inequality the dispute spilled onto
national television race and class is
very closely aligned but it's not just
the current disadvantage it's the legacy
of disadvantaged my main point is that
it's actually unnecessary and we need to
make the effort to find other ways now
not in a furious time but now of
addressing the issue of disadvantaged
Wando and Petula is finishing his fourth
year at the University's medical school
considered to be one of the continents
finest UC T's policies are now aimed at
admitting and retaining students like
Wando who went to a struggling High
School in nearby black township for him
it was a very big leap I don't think I

students
